25.intro: Myriad enables co-existence of Apache Hadoop YARN and Apache Mesos together on the same cluster and allows dynamic resource allocations across both Hadoop and other applications running on the same physical data center infrastructure.

87.intro: Curator - ZooKeeper client wrapper and rich ZooKeeper framework

283.intro: The Lokahi project will create a management console for Apache HTTP Server and Apache Tomcat projects on a framework extensible to other ASF projects. Retired due to inactivity. Some talk of moving parts of the codebase to Tomcat.

268.intro: Gearpump is a reactive real-time streaming engine based on the micro-service Actor model. Retired

304.intro: implementations of various W3C and OASIS specifications related to XML and Web services security Failed to gather community momentum. Cancelled at request of Sponsoring TLP.

168.intro: NetBeans is a development environment, tooling platform and application framework.

38.intro: Apache Spot is a platform for network telemetry built on an open data model and Apache Hadoop.

5.intro: Crail is a storage platform for sharing performance critical data in distributed data processing jobs at very high speed.

246.intro: Whirr provides code for running a variety of software services on cloud infrastructure.

290.intro: Tools and libraries for developing Attribute-based Access Control (ABAC) Systems in a variety of languages. Retired for lack of activity

247.intro: A web application framework that focusses on bringing plain object oriented Java programming to the web tier

88.intro: The CXF project will create a SOA services framework by merges the ObjectWeb Celtix project and the Codehaus XFire project.

161.intro: Metron is a project dedicated to providing an extensible and scalable advanced network security analytics tool. It has strong foundations in the Apache Hadoop ecosystem.

99.intro: Apache Eagle is an open source analytics solution for identifying security and performance issues instantly on big data platforms, e.g. Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark. It analyzes data activities, yarn applications, jmx metrics, and daemon logs etc., provides state-of-the-art alert engine to identify security breach, performance issues and shows insights.

136.intro: Java framework for building Semantic Web applications.

256.intro: ARIA TOSCA project offers an easily consumable Software Development Kit(SDK) and a Command Line Interface(CLI) to implement TOSCA(Topology and Orchestration Specification of Cloud Applications) based solutions.

31.intro: Ratis is a java implementation for RAFT consensus protocol

96.intro: DistributedLog is a high-performance replicated log service. It offers durability, replication and strong consistency, which provides a fundamental building block for building reliable distributed systems.

2.intro: Annotator provides annotation enabling code for browsers, servers, and humans.

269.intro: Gossip is an implementation of the Gossip Protocol. Retired

178.intro: Server-based workflow scheduling and coordination system to manage data processing jobs for Apache Hadoop

280.intro: Kalumet a complete environment manager and deployer including J2EE environments (application servers, applications, etc), softwares, and resources. Podling retired from incubation.

28.intro: PageSpeed represents a series of open source technologies to help make the web faster by rewriting web pages to reduce latency and bandwidth.

32.intro: Rya (pronounced "ree-uh") is a cloud-based RDF triple store that supports SPARQL queries. Rya is a scalable RDF data management system built on top of Accumulo. Rya uses novel storage methods, indexing schemes, and query processing techniques that scale to billions of triples across multiple nodes. Rya provides fast and easy access to the data through SPARQL, a conventional query mechanism for RDF data.

56.intro: Ambari is a monitoring, administration and lifecycle management project for Apache Hadoop clusters. (Formerly known as HMS)

118.intro: Groovy is an object-oriented programming language for the Java platform. It is a language with features similar to those of Python, Ruby, Java, Perl, and Smalltalk.

251.intro: XML-Java binding tool with 100%% support for XML Schema and full Infoset fidelity

267.intro: Droids aims to be an intelligent standalone robot framework that allows to create and extend existing droids (robots). Retired from incubation.

307.intro: Implementation of OASIS Web Services for Remote Portlets (WSRP)

217.intro: Sqoop is a tool designed for efficiently transferring bulk data between Apache Hadoop and structured datastores such as relational databases.

24.intro: A Flexible and Efficient Library for Deep Learning

142.intro: Kafka is a distributed publish-subscribe system for processing large amounts of streaming data.

9.intro: olphinScheduler is a distributed ETL scheduling engine with powerful DAG visualization interface..

127.intro: The iBATIS Data Mapper framework makes it easier to use a database with Java or .NET applications. iBATIS couples objects with stored procedures or SQL statements using a XML descriptor.

302.intro: An infrastructure for cloud computing on big data.

34.intro: SAMOA provides a collection of distributed streaming algorithms for the most common data mining and machine learning tasks such as classification, clustering, and regression, as well as programming abstractions to develop new algorithms that run on top of distributed stream processing engines (DSPEs). It features a pluggable architecture that allows it to run on several DSPEs such as Apache Storm, Apache S4, and Apache Samza.

210.intro: Security framework. (Initially known as JSecurity or Ki, renamed June 2009)

300.intro: SocialSite is an OpenSocial-based headless social networking server and a set of OpenSocial Gadgets that make it easy to add social features to existing web sites. Server provides admin console for configuration, gadget approval and management. Gadgets can be combined to form complete UI for social networking with friending, group management and message support.

288.intro: Java modules that allow programmatic creation, scanning and manipulation of OpenDocument Format (ISO/IEC 26300 == ODF) documents Retired from the ASF and moved to The Document Foundation

150.intro: Logging for C++. N.B. This is a reboot of the Log4cxx podling which previously graduated.

52.intro: A robust and high performance Message Orientated Middleware provider which will be integrated into Apache Geronimo but also be usable from inside any JVM.

128.intro: A unified In-Memory Data Fabric providing high-performance, distributed in-memory data management software layer between various data sources and user applications.

73.intro: Apache CarbonData is a new Apache Hadoop native file format for faster interactive query using advanced columnar storage, index, compression and encoding techniques to improve computing efficiency, in turn it will help speedup queries an order of magnitude faster over PetaBytes of data.

286.intro: .NET integration for Maven. Failed to build active community. Efforts moved to NPanday. Other similar projects are NMaven @ Codeplex (http://www.codeplex.com/nmaven/) and Byldan @ Codeplex (http://www.codeplex.com/byldan/).

154.intro: A loose port of the Lucene search engine library, written in C and targeted at dynamic language users.

163.intro: FTP protocol module for Apache httpd 2.x

81.intro: CloudStack is an IaaS (Infrastracture as a Service? cloud orchestration platform.

90.intro: Deltacloud, cloud API (REST) and abstraction framework

93.intro: Apache DeviceMap is a data repository containing device information, images and other relevant information for all sorts of mobile devices, e.g. smartphones and tablets. While the focus is initially on that data, APIs will also be created to use and manage it.

126.intro: CLI integration project for httpd server

55.intro: Forge software for the development of software projects, including source control systems, issue tracking, discussion, wiki, and other software project management tools.

46.intro: TVM is a full stack open deep learning compiler stack for CPUs, GPUs, and specialized accelerators. It aims to close the gap between the productivity-focused deep learning frameworks, and the performance- or efficiency-oriented hardware backends.

23.intro: Milagro is core security infrastructure and crypto libraries for decentralized networks and distributed systems.

141.intro: Apache Juneau is a toolkit for marshalling POJOs to a wide variety of content types using a common framework, and for creating sophisticated self-documenting REST interfaces and microservices using VERY little code.

85.intro: Crunch is a Java library for writing, testing, and running pipelines of MapReduce jobs on Apache Hadoop.

47.intro: a distributed endpoint monitoring solution where the agent is hosted on your own hardware.

274.intro: HORN is a neuron-centric programming APIs and execution framework for large-scale deep learning, built on top of Apache Hama. Retired

62.intro: Apache AsterixDB is a scalable big data management system (BDMS) that provides storage, management, and query capabilities for large collections of semi-structured data.

104.intro: A data processing and management solution for Hadoop designed for data motion, coordination of data pipelines, lifecycle management, and data discovery.

164.intro: MRUnit is a library to support unit testing of Hadoop MapReduce jobs.

115.intro: Giraph is a large-scale, fault-tolerant, Bulk Synchronous Parallel (BSP)-based graph processing framework.

98.intro: Dubbo is a high-performance, lightweight, java based RPC framework.

37.intro: SINGA is a distributed deep learning platform.

292.intro: Pirk is a framework for scalable Private Information Retrieval (PIR). Retired due to inactivity.

234.intro: Apache Traffic Control can be used to build, monitor, configure, and provision a large-scale content delivery network (CDN).

155.intro: Big Data Machine Learning in SQL for Data Scientists.

67.intro: Extensible Java application framework with an integrated metadata-driven programming model for web services, web applications, and resource access

179.intro: A tool for scalable comparison of remote sensing observations to climate model outputs, regionally and globally.

297.intro: S4 (Simple Scalable Streaming System) is a general-purpose, distributed, scalable, partially fault-tolerant, pluggable platform that allows programmers to easily develop applications for processing continuous, unbounded streams of data.

102.intro: Enterprise Social Messaging Experiment (ESME) is a secure and highly scalable microsharing and micromessaging platform that allows people to discover and meet one another and get controlled access to other sources of information, all in a business process context.

106.intro: Fineract is an open source system for core banking as a platform.

257.intro: AWF is a non-blocking, asynchronous, event driven high performance web framework running on the JVM.    (Note: originally known as Deft, renamed to AWF on 2012-02-15) Retired for lack of activity

159.intro: Mesos is a cluster manager that provides resource sharing and isolation across cluster applications.

41.intro: Taverna is a domain-independent suite of tools used to design and execute data-driven workflows.

263.intro: Apache Concerted is a Do-It-Yourself toolkit for building in-memory data engines. Retired for lack of activity

171.intro: Nuvem defines an open application programming interface for common cloud application services, allowing applications to be easily ported across the most popular cloud platforms.    The podling was voted to become part of Tuscany in Nov 2012 but (as of Aug 2014) nothing has happened. Tuscany was terminated in May 2016.

200.intro: REEF (Retainable Evaluator Execution Framework) is a scale-out computing fabric that eases the development of Big Data applications on top of resource managers such as Apache YARN and Mesos.

129.intro: Impala is a high-performance C++ and Java SQL query engine for data stored in Apache Hadoop-based clusters.

258.intro: Relational database engine written in Java. Project remains at Axion Tigris.org

277.intro: Open source system that enables the orchestration of IoT devices.

174.intro: Object-Graph Notation Language implementation in Java

275.intro: HTrace is a tracing framework intended for use with distributed systems written in java. HTrace made several releases however energy gradually evaporated and a community retirement VOTE was held with the RESULT that HTrace be retired.

176.intro: Apache Onami aims to create a community focused on the development and maintenance of a set of Google Guice extensions not provided out of the box by the library itself nor the Google developers team, such as integration with 3rd part frameworks or extra functionalities.

48.intro: Weex is a framework for building Mobile cross-platform high performance UI.

134.intro: A cloud agnostic library that enables developers to access a variety of supported cloud providers using one API

107.intro: Application framework for building Flash-based applications.

211.intro: The Spatial Information System (SIS) Project is a toolkit that spatial information system builders or users can leverage to build applications containing location context.

33.intro: S2Graph is a distributed and scalable OLTP graph database built on Apache HBase to support fast traversal of extremely large graphs.

120.intro: Hama is a distributed computing framework based on BSP (Bulk Synchronous Parallel) computing techniques for massive scientific computations, e.g., matrix, graph and network algorithms.

105.intro: Implementation of the OSGi R4 specification. (Formerly known as Oscar)

109.intro: Flume is a distributed, reliable, and available system for efficiently collecting, aggregating, and moving large amounts of log data from many different sources to a centralized data store.

158.intro: Merlin eclipse plugin merged with an existing eclipse plugin already at avalon.

216.intro: Spark is an open source system for fast and flexible large-scale data analysis. Spark provides a general purpose runtime that supports low-latency execution in several forms.

291.intro: A Photo Gallery application, accessible via the web and written in Java Retired due to inactivity.

207.intro: ServiceComb is a microservice framework that provides a set of tools and components to make development and deployment of cloud applications easier.

272.intro: Identity for the rest of us. Project retired. Some activity moved to OpenID.net

11.intro: Druid is a high-performance, column-oriented, distributed data store.

190.intro: Pig is a platform for analyzing large datasets.

116.intro: Gora is an ORM framework for column stores such as Apache HBase and Apache Cassandra with a specific focus on Hadoop.

123.intro: HCatalog is a table and storage management service for data created using Apache Hadoop. HCatalog became part of the Hive project

284.intro: Lucene for C. Progress stalled as developers ran out of free time and motivation.

149.intro: Logging for C++. N.B. the code has re-entered the Incubator as log4cxx2.

43.intro: Toree provides applications with a mechanism to interactively and remotely access Apache Spark.

296.intro: Ripple is a browser based mobile phone emulator designed to aid in the development of HTML5 based mobile applications.  Ripple is a cross platform and cross runtime testing/debugging tool. It currently supports such runtimes as Cordova, WebWorks aand the Mobile Web. Retired for lack of activity

157.intro: An open implementation of a Linked Data Platform.

57.intro: The Amber project will deliver a Java development framework mainly aimed to build OAuth-aware applications. Amber graduated with the name Apache Oltu

236.intro: Trafodion is a webscale SQL-on-Hadoop solution enabling transactional or operational workloads on Hadoop.

218.intro: A modular software stack and reusable set of components for semantic content management

60.intro: A robust implementation of the OASIS WS-ResourceFramework (WSRF) family of specifications

108.intro: Flink is an open source system for expressive, declarative, fast, and efficient data analysis. Stratosphere combines the scalability and programming flexibility of distributed MapReduce-like platforms with the efficiency, out-of-core execution, and query optimization capabilities found in parallel databases.  Flink was originally known as Stratosphere when it entered the Incubator.

208.intro: The ServiceMix project will create an ESB and component suite based on the Java Business Interface (JBI) standard - JSR 208.

235.intro: A scalable and extensible HTTP proxy server and cache.

100.intro: Easyant is a build system based on Apache Ant and Apache Ivy.

40.intro: Tamaya is a highly flexible configuration solution based on an modular, extensible and injectable key/value based design, which should provide a minimal but extendible modern and functional API leveraging SE, ME and EE environments.

287.intro: NPanday allows projects using the .NET framework to be built with Apache Maven. Retired for lack of activity

241.intro: Unomi is a reference implementation of the OASIS Context Server specification currently being worked on by the OASIS Context Server Technical Committee. It provides a high-performance user profile and event tracking server.

89.intro: DataFu provides a collection of Hadoop MapReduce jobs and functions in higher level languages based on it to perform data analysis. It provides functions for common statistics tasks (e.g. quantiles, sampling), PageRank, stream sessionization, and set and bag operations. DataFu also provides Hadoop jobs for incremental data processing in MapReduce.

181.intro: OpenJPA is an open source implementation of the Java Persistence API

308.intro: Declarative framework for building Ajax-powered web apps

145.intro: Kylin is a distributed and scalable OLAP engine built on Hadoop to support extremely large datasets.

138.intro: Joshua is a statistical machine translation toolkit

68.intro: Bigtop is a project for the development of packaging and tests of the Hadoop ecosystem.

220.intro: Storm is a distributed, fault-tolerant, and high-performance realtime computation system that provides strong guarantees on the processing of data.

254.intro: ALOIS is a log collection and correlation software with reporting and alarming functionalities. Podling requested to be retired

94.intro: DirectMemory's main purpose is to to act as a second level cache able to store large amounts of data without filling up the Java heap and thus avoiding long garbage collection cycles.

58.intro: Anything To Triples (any23) is a library, a web service and a command line tool that extracts structured data in RDF format from a variety of Web documents.

232.intro: TinkerPop is a graph computing framework written in Java

26.intro: Nemo is a data processing system to flexibly control the runtime behaviors of a job to adapt to varying deployment characteristics.

7.intro: DataSketches is an open source, high-performance library of stochastic streaming algorithms commonly called "sketches" in the data sciences. Sketches are small, stateful programs that process massive data as a stream and can provide approximate answers, with mathematical guarantees, to computationally difficult queries orders-of-magnitude faster than traditional, exact methods.

76.intro: Celix is an OSGi like implementation in C with a distinct focus on interoperability between Java and C.

223.intro: Subversion is an open-source version control system, with a long and detailed list of features. (See http://subversion.apache.org/features.html)

169.intro: NiFi is a dataflow system based on the concepts of flow-based programming.

261.intro: CMDA provides web services for multi-aspect physics-based and phenomenon-oriented climate model performance evaluation and diagnosis through the comprehensive and synergistic use of multiple observational data, reanalysis data, and model outputs. Retired for lack of on list activity and primary development being outside the ASF

44.intro: The Training project aims to develop resources which can be used for training purposes in various media formats, languages and for various Apache and non-Apache target projects.

78.intro: Chukwa is a log collection and analysis framework for Apache Hadoop clusters.

227.intro: Tajo is a distributed data warehouse system for Hadoop.

112.intro: A complete FTP Server based on Mina I/O system.

147.intro: Content Management and publishing system based on Cocoon

299.intro: Slider is a collection of tools and technologies to package, deploy, and manage long running applications on Apache Hadoop YARN clusters. Development of long-running service support for Apache Hadoop YARN has been moved to the hadoop-yarn-services-core module in Apache Hadoop.

219.intro: The Apache C++ Standard Library project is a complete implementation of the ISO/IEC 14882 C++ Standard Library.

266.intro: Integrated tools for automating downloading, publishing and managing software artifacts, along with tools for manipulating their metadata. Project closed after development stalled.

285.intro: MRQL is a query processing and optimization system for large-scale, distributed data analysis, built on top of Apache Hadoop, Hama, Spark, and Flink. Retired.

276.intro: Rule-based Management Policy Engine Although the Apache Imperius project was successful in building an SPL implementation and had a successful release, there is not sufficient community energy to warrant continued development of Imperius at the Apache Software Foundation.

14.intro: Flagon is a software tool usability testing platform

45.intro: Tuweni is a set of libraries and other tools to aid development of blockchain and other decentralized software in Java and other JVM languages.

30.intro: Pony Mail is a mail-archiving, archive viewing, and interaction service, that can be integrated with many email platforms.

199.intro: Rave is A WEb And SOcial Mashup Engine.

63.intro: Apache Atlas is a scalable and extensible set of core foundational governance services that enables enterprises to effectively and efficiently meet their compliance requirements within Hadoop and allows integration with the complete enterprise data ecosystem

309.intro: C++ equivalent of Apache XMLBeans. Failed to get traction.

205.intro: The Sanselan Project is a pure-java image library for reading and writing a variety of image formats.

122.intro: HAWQ is an advanced enterprise SQL on Hadoop analytic engine built around a robust and high-performance massively-parallel processing (MPP) SQL framework evolved from Pivotal Greenplum Database.

165.intro: A robust implementation of the OASIS WSDM, Management using Web Services (MuWS) specification

250.intro: a W3C widget engine with Google Wave and Open Social Extensions.

198.intro: Comprehension and auditing for distributions and source code Became part of new Apache Creadur TLP

153.intro: Lucene.NET is a source code, class-per-class, API-per-API and algorithmatic port of the Java Lucene search engine to the C# and .NET platform utilizing Microsoft .NET Framework.

66.intro: The Bean Validation project will create an implementation of Bean Validation as defined by the Java EE specifications. Graduated as Apache BVal

271.intro: Eclipse based tools for developing applications on the Hadoop platform Retired at request of PPMC as the project failed to grow community.

72.intro: Calcite is a highly customizable engine for parsing and planning queries on data in a wide variety of formats. It allows database-like access, and in particular a SQL interface and advanced query optimization, for data not residing in a traditional database. (Renamed from Optiq on 2014-09-30.)

162.intro: Mnemonic is a Java based non-volatile memory library for in-place structured data processing and computing.

222.intro: Apache Streams is a lightweight server for ActivityStreams.

195.intro: Pulsar is a highly scalable, low latency messaging platform running on commodity hardware. It provides simple pub-sub semantics over topics, guaranteed at-least-once delivery of messages, automatic cursor management for subscribers, and cross-datacenter replication.

61.intro: The Aries project will deliver a set of pluggable Java components enabling an enterprise OSGi application programming model.

204.intro: Samza is a stream processing system for running continuous computation on    infinite streams of data.

29.intro: Pinot is a distributed columnar storage engine that can ingest data in real-time and serve analytical queries at low latency.

281.intro: Kato is a project to develop the Specification, Reference Implementation, and TCK for JSR 326: the JVM Post-mortem Diagnostics API. Retired due to inactivity.

130.intro: The Isis project will be an extensible standards-based framework to rapidly develop and enterprise level deploy domain-driven (DDD) applications.

70.intro: Brooklyn is a framework for modelling, monitoring, and managing applications through autonomic blueprints.

22.intro: Marvin-AI is an open-source artificial intelligence (AI) platform that helps data scientists, prototype and productionalize complex solutions with a scalable, low-latency, language-agnostic, and standardized architecture while simplifies the process of exploration and modeling.

53.intro: A software suite to compose, manage, execute, and monitor large scale applications and workflows on computational resources ranging from local clusters to national grids and computing clouds.

197.intro: The Ranger project is a framework to enable, monitor and manage comprehensive data security across the Hadoop platform.    (The podling was originally called Argus)

119.intro: Guacamole is an enterprise-grade, protocol-agnostic, remote desktop gateway. Combined with cloud hosting, Guacamole provides an excellent alternative to traditional desktops. Guacamole aims to make cloud-hosted desktop access preferable to traditional, local access.

233.intro: A JSF based framework for web-applications.

196.intro: Qpid provides multiple language implementations of the Advanced Messaged Queuing Protocol (AMQP)

202.intro: RocketMQ is a fast, low latency, reliable, scalable, distributed, easy to use message-oriented middleware, especially for processing large amounts of streaming data.

16.intro: A real-time, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine.

140.intro: Implementation of a Universal Description Discovery and Integration (UDDI) registry

295.intro: JSF Component Library. Never got started, so retired.

124.intro: Apache Helix is a generic cluster management framework used to build distributed systems and provides automatic partition management, fault tolerance and elasticity.

113.intro: Geode is a data management platform that provides real-time, consistent access to data-intensive applications throughout widely distributed cloud architectures.

177.intro: A grid middleware framework for science data processing, information integration, and retrieval.

3.intro: BatchEE projects aims to provide a JBatch implementation (aka JSR352) and a set of useful extensions for this specification.

192.intro: PLC4X is a set of libraries for communicating with industrial programmable logic controllers (PLCs) using a variety of protocols but with a shared API.

173.intro: The Open For Business Project (OFBiz) is an open source enterprise automation software project.

166.intro: MyFaces is a framework for building Java Server application GUIs based on JavaServer Faces (certified implementation of JSR-127).

260.intro: Blur is a search platform capable of searching massive amounts of data    in a cloud computing environment. Retired

209.intro: The Shindig Project is an OpenSocial container.

36.intro: Sharding-Sphere is an ecosystem of transparent distributed database middleware, focusing on data sharding, distributed transaction and database orchestration.

213.intro: Sling is a framework to develop content centric web applications based on the idea of modularizing the rendering of HTTP resources.

6.intro: Apache Daffodil is an implementation of the Data Format Description Language (DFDL) used to convert between fixed format data and XML/JSON.

226.intro: SystemML provides declarative large-scale machine learning (ML) that aims at flexible specification of ML algorithms and automatic generation of hybrid runtime plans ranging from single node, in-memory computations, to distributed computations such as Apache Hadoop MapReduce and Apache Spark.

71.intro: Buildr is a simple and intuitive build system for Java projects written in Ruby.

229.intro: Tez is an effort to develop a generic application framework which can be used to process arbitrarily complex data-processing tasks and also a re-usable set of data-processing primitives which can be used by other projects.

293.intro: Provisionr provides a service to manage pools of virtual machines on multiple clouds. Failed to grow a community. Retired at request of PPMC.

146.intro: Lens is a platform that enables multi-dimensional queries in a unified way over datasets stored in multiple warehouses. Lens integrates Apache Hive with other data warehouses by tiering them together to form logical data cubes.

148.intro: libcloud is a standard client library for many popular cloud providers, written in python

278.intro: OpenSSL based JCE provider. Project going into retired status after lack of community interest.

117.intro: Griffin is a open source Data Quality solution for distributed data systems at any scale in both streaming or batch data context

294.intro: Quickstep is a high-performance database engine. Retired for lack of activity

225.intro: An Open Source system for managing digital identities in enterprise environments, implemented in JEE technology

13.intro: Edgent is a stream processing programming model and lightweight runtime to execute analytics at devices on the edge or at the gateway. (Formerly known as Quarks)

255.intro: A transparent Remote Procedure Call bean. Development stalled and the project activity transferred to JRemoting

265.intro: Cotton is an Apache Mesos framework for running MySQL instances. (Formerly known as Mysos) Retired for lack of activity

65.intro: Apache Beam is an open source, unified model and set of language-specific SDKs for defining and executing data processing workflows, and also data ingestion and integration flows, supporting Enterprise Integration Patterns (EIPs) and Domain Specific Languages (DSLs). Dataflow pipelines simplify the mechanics of large-scale batch and streaming data processing and can run on a number of runtimes like Apache Flink, Apache Spark, and Google Cloud Dataflow (a cloud service). Beam also brings DSL in different languages, allowing users to easily implement their data integration processes.

69.intro: Bloodhound is a software development collaboration tool, including issue tracking, wiki and repository browsing.

242.intro: Usergrid is Backend-as-a-Service (BaaS) composed of an integrated database (Cassandra), application layer and client tier with SDKs for developers.

239.intro: Twill is an abstraction over Apache Hadoop YARN that reduces the complexity of developing distributed applications, allowing developers to focus more on their business logic

97.intro: Drill is a distributed system for interactive analysis of large-scale datasets, inspired by Google's Dremel.

191.intro: A platform for building rich internet applications in Java.

86.intro: cTAKES (clinical Text Analysis and Knowledge Extraction System) is an natural language processing tool for information extraction from electronic medical record clinical free-text.

42.intro: Tephra is a system for providing globally consistent transactions on top of Apache HBase and other storage engines.

10.intro: Doris is a MPP-based interactive SQL data warehousing for reporting and analysis.

125.intro: A robust implementation of the OASIS WS-Notification (WSN) family of specifications

182.intro: Openmeetings is a web conferencing solution.

133.intro: Implementation of JAXB, the specification for Java/XML binding

305.intro: a robust hetorgeneous clustering engine used to cluster geronimo, tomcat, jetty and other containers eventually. Proposal withdrawn by creator; project continues at Codehaus.

143.intro: Knox Gateway is a system that provides a single point of secure access for Apache Hadoop clusters.

79.intro: an OSGi-based modular application and set of components (bundles) for building RESTFul Semantic Web applications and services.

15.intro: Gobblin is a distributed data integration framework that simplifies common aspects of big data integration such as data ingestion, replication, organization and lifecycle management for both streaming and batch data ecosystems.

21.intro: Livy is web service that exposes a REST interface for managing long running Apache Spark contexts in your cluster. With Livy, new applications can be built on top of Apache Spark that require fine grained interaction with many Spark contexts.

301.intro: Stonehenge is a set of interoperability scenarios for Service Oriented Architecture and Web Services that demonstrate interoperability between multiple systems including Apache Axis2, WSF/PHP and Microsoft WCF. The code also demonstrates good practice for standards-based interoperability.     "The Stonehenge project pretty much accomplished what it originally    set out to do and then really didn't find a way to transition to    something that is longer lasting and able to develop a community    around it."

253.intro: Extensible Business Process Management (BPM) engine core. Project activity transferred to another Incubator project - ODE.

184.intro: OpenOffice.org is comprised of six personal productivity applications: a word processor (and its web-authoring component), spreadsheet, presentation graphics, drawing, equation editor, and database.

156.intro: Connectors for content repositories like Sharepoint, Documentum, etc.

59.intro: Apex is an enterprise grade native YARN big data-in-motion platform that unifies stream processing as well as batch processing.

306.intro: A wave is a hosted, live, concurrent data structure for rich communication. It can be used like email, chat, or a document.

189.intro: Phoenix is an open source SQL query engine for Apache HBase, a NoSQL data store. It is accessed as a JDBC driver and enables querying and managing HBase tables using SQL.

131.intro: A java based tool for tracking, resolving and managing project dependencies.

35.intro: SDAP is an integrated data analytic center for Big Science problems.

137.intro: Implementation of JSR-353 JavaTM API for JSON Processing (Renamed from Fleece)

49.intro: An implementation of the Atom Syndication Format and Atom Publishing Protocol.

264.intro: Corinthia is a toolkit/application for converting between and editing common office file formats, with an initial focus on word processing. It is designed to cater for multiple classes of platforms - desktop, web, and mobile - and relies heavily on web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for representing and manipulating documents. The toolkit is small, portable, and flexible, with minimal dependencies. The target audience is developers wishing to include office viewing, conversion, and editing functionality into their applications. Retired for lack of activity

64.intro: Aurora is a service scheduler used to schedule jobs onto Apache Mesos.

51.intro: A software distribution framework based on OSGi that allows you to manage and distribute artifacts.

1.intro: Apache Amaterasu is a framework providing continuous deployment for Big Data pipelines.

244.intro: A standards compliant XML Query processor.

4.intro: brpc is an industrial-grade RPC framework for building reliable and high-performance services.

243.intro: Virtual Computing Lab. Framework for creating, dispensing and running virtual images.

91.intro: DeltaSpike is a collection of JSR-299 (CDI) Extensions for building applications on the Java SE and EE platforms.

39.intro: Superset is an enterprise-ready web application for data exploration, data visualization and dashboarding.

27.intro: Omid is a flexible, reliable, high performant and scalable ACID transactional framework that allows client applications to execute transactions on top of MVCC key/value-based NoSQL datastores (currently Apache HBase) providing Snapshot Isolation guarantees on the accessed data.

144.intro: Kudu is a distributed columnar storage engine built for the Apache Hadoop ecosystem.

221.intro: Stratos will be a polyglot PaaS framework, providing developers a cloud-based environment for developing, testing, and running scalable applications, and IT providers high utilization rates, automated resource management, and platform-wide insight including monitoring and billing.

194.intro: PredictionIO is an open source Machine Learning Server built on top of state-of-the-art open source stack, that enables developers to manage and deploy production-ready predictive services for various kinds of machine learning tasks.

160.intro: MetaModel is a data access framework, providing a common interface for exploration and querying of different types of datastores.

19.intro: Iceberg is a table format for large, slow-moving tabular data.

167.intro: Mynewt is a real-time operating system for constrained embedded systems like wearables, lightbulbs, locks and doorbells. It works on a variety of 32-bit MCUs (microcontrollers), including ARM Cortex-M and MIPS architectures.

103.intro: A cross-platform, language- and transport-independent framework for building and consuming network services.

311.intro: Zeta Components is a high-quality library of loosely-coupled PHP components.

132.intro: Content Repository API based on JSR 170

252.intro: A collaborative data analytics and visualization tool for distributed, general-purpose data processing systems such as Apache Spark, Apache Flink, etc.

12.intro: ECharts is a charting and data visualization library written in JavaScript.

83.intro: Apache Cordova is a platform for building native mobile applications using HTML, CSS and JavaScript (formerly Phonegap). The project entered incubation as Callback, but decided to change its name to Cordova on 2011-11-28.

54.intro: Airflow is a workflow automation and scheduling system that can be used to author and manage data pipelines.

312.intro: Zipkin is a distributed tracing system. It helps gather timing data needed to troubleshoot latency problems in microservice architectures. The podling has retired to its former community OpenZipkin (https://zipkin.io)

82.intro: Commons RDF is a set of interfaces and classes for RDF 1.1 concepts and behaviours.  The commons-rdf-api module defines interfaces and testing harness.  The commons-rdf-simple module provides a basic reference implementation to exercise the test harness and clarify API contracts.

17.intro: Hivemall is a library for machine learning implemented as Hive UDFs/UDAFs/UDTFs.

270.intro: Portal oriented Content Management System (Formerly known as JCMS)

20.intro: IoTDB is a data store for managing large amounts of time series data such as timestamped data from IoT sensors in industrial applications.

183.intro: OpenNLP is a machine learning based toolkit for the processing of natural language text.

50.intro: Accumulo is a distributed key/value store that provides expressive, cell-level access labels.

248.intro: Apache Wink is a project that enables development and consumption of REST style web services. The core server runtime is based on the JAX-RS (JSR 311) standard. The project also introduces a client runtime which can leverage certain components of the server-side runtime. Apache Wink will deliver component technology that can be easily integrated into a variety of environments.

110.intro: Fluo is a distributed system for incrementally processing large data sets stored in Accumulo.

228.intro: Alternative framework to JSP and Velocity scripting environments

303.intro: SPARQL endpoint for your webserver. Project entering retired status after failing to get traction.

18.intro: Hudi provides atomic upserts and incremental data streams on Big Data

206.intro: Sentry is a highly modular system for providing fine grained role    based authorization to both data and metadata stored on an Apache Hadoop cluster.

282.intro: Kitty is a lightweight, production focused, Java-based application server performance diagnostic and management utility. Retired due to inactivity.

212.intro: Skywalking is an APM (application performance monitor), especially for microservice, Cloud Native and container-based architecture systems. Also known as a distributed tracing system. It provides an automatic way to instrument applications: no need to change any of the source code of the target application; and an collector with an very high efficiency streaming module.

111.intro: FreeMarker is a template engine, i.e. a generic tool to generate text output based on templates. FreeMarker is implemented in Java as a class library for programmers.

188.intro: PDF library (reading, text extraction, manipulation, viewer)

8.intro: DLab is a platform for creating self-service, exploratory data science environments in the cloud using best-of-breed data science tools.

187.intro: Parquet is a columnar storage format for Hadoop.
